{{infobox College swim team | name = Florida Gators | image = Florida Gators logo.svg | imagesize = 150 px | hex1 = #0021A5 | hex2 = #FF4A00 | founded = 1930 | conference = [[Southeastern Conference]] | conferenceshort = SEC | history = | home pool = [[O'Connell Center|Natatorium]]
[[Carse Complex]] | city = Gainesville | state = Florida | stateabb = FL | color1 = [[Blue]] | color2 = [[Orange (colour)|Orange]] | coach = [[Gregg Troy]] (swimming)
Donnie Crane (diving) | men's ncaa = '''2''' (1983, 1984) | women's ncaa = '''3''' (1979, 1982, 2010) | men's conference = '''33''' (1937, 1938, 1939, 1940, 1941, 1953, 1954, 1956, 1957, 1958, 1959, 1960, 1961, 1962, 1963, 1964, 1965, 1966, 1967, 1968, 1970, 1971, 1978, 1979, 1980, 1982, 1983, 1984, 1985, 1989, 1990, 1991, 1992) | women's conference= '''18''' (1980, 1981, 1982, 1983, 1985, 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989, 1990, 1991, 1992, 1993, 1994, 1995, 2001, 2008, 2010) }} [[Image:UF CarseSwimmingComplex.jpg|right|265px|thumb|Carse Swimming Complex]] The '''Florida Gators swimming and diving''' program represents the [[University of Florida]] in the aquatics sports of [[swimming (sport)|swimming]] and [[diving]]. The program includes separate men's and women's teams, both of which compete in [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] of the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA) and the [[Southeastern Conference]] (SEC). The Gators host their home meets in the O'Connell Center [[O'Connell Center|Natatorium]] on the university's [[Gainesville, Florida]] campus, and are currently led by head swimming coach [[Gregg Troy]] and head diving coach Donnie Crane. In the seventy-nine-year history of the Gators swimming and diving program, the men have won thirty-three SEC team championships and two NCAA national championships; the Lady Gators have won eighteen SEC team championships and three national championships. == Florida Gators Olympic medalists == The University of Florida has been represented in every [[Summer Olympic Games]] since 1968, and the Gators swimming and diving program has produced over eighty-five athletes who have competed in the Olympics since the program was started. The following is a list of former Florida swimmers and divers who won a gold, silver or bronze medal in a swimming or diving event in the [[Summer Olympic Games]]: * '''[[Theresa Andrews]]''', American gold medalist at [[1984 Los Angeles Olympics]] * '''[[Duncan Armstrong]]''', Australian gold medalist at [[1988 Seoul Olympics]] * '''[[Catie Ball]]''', American gold medalist at [[1968
